39-year-old.context: The patient is a 39-year-old Caucasian male who presented to ABCD General Hospital Emergency Department with acute onset of odynophagia and globus sensation.

Caucasian.context: The patient is a 39-year-old Caucasian male who presented to ABCD General Hospital Emergency Department with acute onset of odynophagia and globus sensation.

odynophagia.context: The patient stated his symptoms began around mid night after returning home _________ ingesting some chicken. The patient felt that he had ingested a chicken bone, tried to dislodge this with fluids and other solid foods as well as sticking his finger down his throat without success.

globus sensation.context: The patient stated his symptoms began around mid night after returning home _________ ingesting some chicken. The patient felt that he had ingested a chicken bone, tried to dislodge this with fluids and other solid foods as well as sticking his finger down his throat without success.

foreign body.context: The patient stated his symptoms began around mid night after returning home _________ ingesting some chicken. The patient felt that he had ingested a chicken bone, tried to dislodge this with fluids and other solid foods as well as sticking his finger down his throat without success.

left vallecula.context: Foreign body, left vallecula at the base of the tongue.

vallecula.context: The scope was further advanced to the level of the oropharynx where the base of the tongue, vallecula, and epiglottis were visualized.

1.5 cm white foreign body.context: There was evidence of a 1.5 cm left vallecular white foreign body.

chicken bone.context: The patient felt that he had ingested a chicken bone, tried to dislodge this with fluids and other solid foods as well as sticking his finger down his throat without success.

mild erythema.context: There is no evidence of supraglottic or piriform sinuses foreign body.   2. Mild erythema of the right nasopharynx in the region of the fossa Rosenmüller.

nasopharynx.context: The nasal laryngoscope was then inserted back into the right naris and it was advanced along the floor of the nasal cavity. The nasal mucous membranes were pink and moist. There was no evidence of mass, ulceration, lesion, or obstruction.   The scope was further advanced to the level of the nasopharynx where the eustachian tubes were visualized bilaterally.

eustachian tubes.context: The scope was further advanced to the level of the nasopharynx where the eustachian tubes were visualized bilaterally.

epiglottis.context: The scope was further advanced to the level of the oropharynx where the base of the tongue, vallecula, and epiglottis were visualized.

omega in shape.context: The epiglottis was within normal limits and was noted to be omega in shape.

Valsalva.context: The patient was asked to Valsalva and the piriform sinuses were observed without evidence of foreign body or mass lesion.

piriform sinuses.context: The patient was asked to Valsalva and the piriform sinuses were observed without evidence of foreign body or mass lesion.

direct laryngoscopy/microscopic suspensi.context: The patient is to go to the operating room for direct laryngoscopy/microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy for removal of foreign body under anesthesia this a.m.

anesthesia.context: The patient is to go to the operating room for direct laryngoscopy/microscopic suspension direct laryngoscopy for removal of foreign body under anesthesia this a.m.
